<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 277, 230, 292]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 904, 292]]<|/det|>
9709/41  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 301, 240, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 4 Mechanics  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[770, 301, 904, 316]]<|/det|>
May/June 2025

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 384, 392, 399]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 221, 432]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 434, 880, 650]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.- Where a numerical value for the acceleration due to gravity \((g)\) is needed, use \(10 \text{ms}^{- 2}\) .  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 680, 212, 694]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 696, 728, 727]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 50.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 72, 99, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 74, 918, 135]]<|/det|>
1 A block of mass 12 kg is being pulled by a rope up a rough plane. The plane is inclined at an angle of \(20^{\circ}\) above the horizontal. The rope pulling the block is parallel to a line of greatest slope of the plane. The coefficient of friction between the block and the plane is 0.4 . The acceleration of the block is \(2 \mathrm{~ms}^{-2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 152, 339, 168]]<|/det|>
Find the tension in the rope.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[2, 35, 25, 194]]<|/det|>
<pre>DO NOT WRITE IN THIS MARGIN

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[2, 200, 25, 320]]<|/det|>
<pre>2

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[331, 85, 670, 228]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 243, 918, 292]]<|/det|>
Three coplanar forces of magnitudes \(P \mathrm{~N}, 5 \mathrm{~N}\) and \(10 \mathrm{~N}\) act at a point \(O\), as shown in the diagram. The resultant of the three forces has magnitude \(Q \mathrm{~N}\) and acts in a direction perpendicular to the force of magnitude \(P \mathrm{~N}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 305, 422, 322]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(P\) and the value of \(Q\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 72, 99, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 71, 97, 88]]<|/det|>
3

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[185, 91, 814, 280]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 297, 918, 361]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the velocity-time graph of the motion of a cyclist. The graph consists of three straight line segments. The cyclist passes a point \(O\) with speed \(3 \mathrm{~ms}^{-1}\) and then accelerates for 10 s with constant acceleration \(0.5 \mathrm{~ms}^{-2}\). He then travels at constant speed for 30 s before decelerating, coming to rest at point \(P\), covering a distance of 80 m whilst decelerating.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 375, 144, 392]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 374, 573, 392]]<|/det|>
(a) Find the total time taken for the journey from \(O\) to \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 75, 144, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 74, 918, 107]]<|/det|>
(b) On the given axes, sketch a displacement-time graph for the cyclist's journey from \(O\) to \(P\), showing on your graph the distances travelled after 10 s and 40 s.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[107, 119, 892, 497]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 72, 99, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 74, 586, 91]]<|/det|>
4 A lorry of mass 18 000 kg is travelling along a straight road.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 106, 144, 122]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 106, 918, 138]]<|/det|>
(a) On a horizontal section of the road, the power of the lorry's engine is constant. There is a constant resistance to motion of 1600 N .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 153, 185, 170]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[188, 152, 918, 184]]<|/det|>
(i) The steady speed which the lorry can maintain with the engine working at power \(P \mathrm{~W}\) is \(30 \mathrm{~ms}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 196, 353, 212]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 411, 188, 427]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 408, 918, 427]]<|/det|>
(ii) At an instant when the speed of the lorry is \(16 \mathrm{~ms}^{-1}\), its engine is working at a power of \(40 \mathrm{kW}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 438, 567, 455]]<|/det|>
Find the acceleration of the lorry at this instant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 650, 144, 667]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 648, 918, 698]]<|/det|>
(b) When the lorry has reached a speed of \(20 \mathrm{~ms}^{-1}\), it begins to ascend a section of road inclined at an angle \(\alpha^{\circ}\) to the horizontal. The engine now works at a power of \(120 \mathrm{kW}\). There is no change in the lorry's speed as it ascends the hill. The constant resistance to motion remains \(1600 \mathrm{~N}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 711, 314, 727]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(\alpha\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 77, 99, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 76, 912, 96]]<|/det|>
5 When a particle \(P\) of mass \(m \mathrm{~kg}\) has speed \(u \mathrm{~ms}^{-1}\), its momentum is \(4 \mathrm{~N} \mathrm{~s}\) and its kinetic energy is \(16 \mathrm{~J}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 110, 144, 127]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 109, 460, 127]]<|/det|>
(a) Find the value of \(m\) and the value of \(u\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 386, 921, 438]]<|/det|>
<pre>\(P\) is now projected on a smooth horizontal surface with speed \(v \mathrm{~ms}^{-1}\) directly towards a particle \(Q\) of mass \(1.25 \mathrm{~kg}\) which is stationary. After \(P\) and \(Q\) collide, the velocity of \(P\) is \(w \mathrm{~ms}^{-1}\) and the velocity of \(Q\) is \(2 w \mathrm{~ms}^{-1}\). The loss of kinetic energy in the collision is 25 J .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 453, 144, 470]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 452, 457, 470]]<|/det|>
(b) Find the value of \(v\) and the value of \(w\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 72, 99, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 71, 97, 88]]<|/det|>
6

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[207, 87, 790, 217]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 235, 918, 330]]<|/det|>
Two particles, \(P\) and \(Q\), of masses 0.3 kg and 0.6 kg respectively, are attached to the ends of a light inextensible string. The string passes over a smooth pulley fixed at a point \(B\) where the inclined planes \(A B\) and \(B C\) meet. \(P\) lies on the smooth plane \(A B\) which is inclined at an angle \(\theta^{\circ}\) to the horizontal where \(\sin \theta^{\circ}=0.4\). \(Q\) lies on the plane \(B C\) which is inclined at \(30^{\circ}\) to the horizontal. The string is taut and the particles can move on lines of greatest slope of the two planes (see diagram). The particles are released from rest.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 346, 144, 363]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 345, 460, 362]]<|/det|>
(a) It is given that the plane \(B C\) is smooth.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 375, 586, 392]]<|/det|>
Find the tension in the string and the acceleration of \(Q\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 75, 144, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 74, 918, 122]]<|/det|>
(b) It is given instead that the plane \(B C\) is rough. The work done against the frictional force when \(Q\) moves 2 m down the plane is 1.8 J . You should assume that \(P\) does not reach the pulley and that \(Q\) does not reach \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 133, 816, 151]]<|/det|>
Use an energy method to find the speed of \(Q\) when it has moved 2 m down the plane.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 72, 99, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 74, 918, 112]]<|/det|>
7 A particle \(X\) moves along a straight track, starting from a point \(O\) at time \(t=0\). The displacement of \(X\) from \(O\) at time \(t\) s is \(s \mathrm{~m}\), where \(s=3 t^{\frac{3}{2}}-6 t\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 127, 144, 144]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 126, 918, 158]]<|/det|>
(a) Find the time at which \(X\) is instantaneously at rest, and hence find the total distance travelled by \(X\) between \(t=0\) and \(t=16\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 75, 918, 121]]<|/det|>
<pre>A second particle \(Y\) moves along another straight track, starting from a point \(P\) at time \(t=0\). The acceleration of \(Y\) at time \(t \mathrm{~s}\) is \(a \mathrm{~ms}^{-2}\), where \(a=0.8-0.6 t\). The velocity of \(Y\) when it leaves \(P\) is \(7.5 \mathrm{~ms}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 138, 144, 154]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 136, 918, 168]]<|/det|>
(b) When the velocity of \(Y\) is \(-9.6 \mathrm{~ms}^{-1}\), show that the displacement of \(X\) from \(O\) is equal to the displacement of \(Y\) from \(P\).

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 73, 567, 89]]<|/det|>
# Additional page  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 102, 918, 135]]<|/det|>
If you use the following page to complete the answer to any question, the question number must be clearly shown.
